intro: Vieusseuxia ciliata, commonly known as the hairy mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are typically red or orange and serve as a food source for various birds and animals. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have a significant impact on the health of its host tree.
